## Overview

The Japan Nosocomial Infections Surveillance (JANIS) is a nationwide surveillance system operated by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare of Japan. JANIS monitors healthcare-associated infections and antimicrobial resistance in Japanese hospitals, providing critical data for infection prevention and control strategies across the country.

## Key Features

- **Nationwide Coverage**: Data from hundreds of participating hospitals across Japan
- **Multiple Surveillance Components**: ICU, surgical site infections, and antimicrobial resistance surveillance
- **Standardized Methods**: Consistent data collection protocols across facilities
- **Real-Time Reporting**: Regular updates from participating institutions
- **Public Reports**: Annual surveillance reports and summary data
- **Benchmarking**: Facility-level comparisons to national averages

## Use Cases in Research

- Japanese healthcare-associated infection epidemiology
- Antimicrobial resistance trends in Japan
- Infection prevention effectiveness evaluation
- International comparison of resistance patterns
- Healthcare policy and guideline development
- Surgical site infection risk factors

Visit the [JANIS website](https://janis.mhlw.go.jp/) to access surveillance reports and learn about the program.
